Class ArrayList<T>

java.lang.Object
ArrayList<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
List<T>
public class ArrayList<T> extends Object implements List<T>
Author:
James Homework #3 In this class, we make the ArrayList class from scratch, using a generic, so any type of object can be passed into this ArrayList. This class also implements the interface List

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ArrayList()
    Default constructor that automatically sets size to 0 and initializes an array with default capacity
    ArrayList(int initialCapacity)
    Constructor that sets size to 0 but now takes in an initial capacity parameter and initializes array with that size

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(T item, int index)
      Adds item into ArrayList at index specified in parameter. Calls the regrow function if ArrayList is full to double capacity. When item is added, size is increased by 1
      Specified by:
      add in interface List<T>
      Parameters:
      item - , index

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears ArrayList by turning all entries in ArrayList to null and setting size to 0
      Specified by:
      clear in interface List<T>

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Object item)
      Iterates through all indexes of ArrayList and looks for item. If found, returns true; if not found, returns false
      Specified by:
      contains in interface List<T>
      Parameters:
      item -

    • get

      public T get(int index)
      Goes into ArrayList at specified index from parameter then returns that object
      Specified by:
      get in interface List<T>
      Parameters:
      index -

    • indexOf

      public int indexOf(Object item)
      Iterates through ArrayList, looking for match of item inside of parameter. When found, returns the index. If not found, returns -1
      Specified by:
      indexOf in interface List<T>
      Parameters:
      item -

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if there are any entries in Arraylist by looking at size
      Specified by:
      isEmpty in interface List<T>

      Returns size of ArrayList
